title: conferred on him by section 18 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961)
heading: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended -
text_raw:
3. The Principal Regulations are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 2, in the definition of “biennial” - 

(i) 

by the substitution of “ ‘biennial’, in relation to a date, 
means the date” for “ ‘biennial’ means a date”, and 

(ii) by the substitution of “that date” for “a test due date”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 3, in paragraph (3) - 

(i) 

by the substitution of “Subject to paragraph (3A), where,” 
for “Where,”, and 

(ii) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 

(3): 

“(3A) Where Regulation 3A applies - 

(a) 

(b) 

each reference in paragraph (3)(a) to “the tenth 
anniversary of first registration of the vehicle” 
shall be read as a reference to “the date that is 
4 months after the tenth anniversary of first 
registration of the vehicle”, 

each reference in paragraphs (3)(b)(i) and (ii) 
to “the tenth anniversary of first registration of 
the vehicle” shall be read as a reference to “the 
date 
tenth 
is 4 months after 
anniversary of first registration of the vehicle”, 
and 

that 

the 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th April, 2020.

(c) 

the reference in paragraph (3)(b)(iii) to “the 
thirtieth anniversary of first registration of the 
vehicle” shall be read as a reference to “the 
date that is 4 months after the thirtieth 
anniversary of first registration of the vehicle”, 

(c) 

by the insertion of the following Regulations after 
Regulation 3: 

“3A. Notwithstanding Regulation 3 and subject to 
Regulation 3B, the test due date for a vehicle to which 
Regulation 3 applies is the date that is 4 months after 
each date 
in accordance with 
Regulation 3 to be a test due date for the vehicle.

referred to in that Regulation where - 

(a) 

(b) 

there was in force on 28 March 2020 a test 
certificate in respect of the vehicle, or 

test due date for 

the first 
the vehicle, 
determined in accordance with Regulation 3, is 
a date during the period beginning on 28 
March 2020 and ending on 31 July 2020.”, 

(d) 

in Regulation 11, by the insertion of the following paragraph 
after paragraph (10): 

in respect of a vehicle 

“(11) Where a test certificate was, on 28 March 
2020, in force 
to which 
Regulation 3A applies, the expiry date of the certificate 
and of the test disc that forms part of that certificate shall 
be the date that is 4 months after the expiry date referred 
to in that certificate and that disc.”, 

and

(e) 

in Regulation 13(1), by the deletion of the words “to which it 
relates”. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
20 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport.

title: conferred on him by section 18 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Road Traffic (National Car Test) Regulations 
2017 (S.I. No. 415 of 2017) to provide that a 4 month extension is given to test 
due dates for vehicles with a test certificate in force on 28 March 2020, or to 
vehicles with a first test due falling during the period beginning on 28 March 
2020 and ending on 31 July 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [132]
